text:
Kia ora guys. As we make our way to Taupo 
 we stop at the geothermic park called

Craters of the Moon, to take a look at some of 
 the geothermic activity that happens here in New Zealand
Colourful creaters and fantastic fumaroles, Fumarol is an opening in which
steam and volcanic ash escape produced by pressurized steam through tiny cracks
Now you know.

Alright so we are in craters of the moon and 
 as you can see this lovely crater behind us

there is also some mud down there, and yesterday 
 we learned that the mud is very base.

so if you put it on your face without 
 being neutralized you can get really bad burns
so although it looks cool its really not good to put on right away.
Otherwise its very beautiful and we are having a good time.

Hey guys. Now we are at Rock n Ropes. 
 It is like an adventure rope course
basically it is an adult jungle gym on steroids.
Ropes that you can grab things, jump on, tightrope....like that one right there.
And I'm going to do that.
You guys can't see this right now, but my entire body is shaking,
and I don't know...that was really scarry!

Welcome to Huka Falls. It is one of the most 
 visited natural  tourist attactions here in New Zealand
Over 200,000 liters of water are falling over these falls every second
That is enough to fill five olympic size swimming pools every minute.
That is a lot of water.

I have an IDEA. You guys want to 
 see the waterfalls in a jetboat?
Lets go do that!
Well, you are probably wondering, Nadine, why are you dressed like a pirate?

well, let me tell you--it is because it is my 
 costume for a lovely boat ride that is celebrating...
...Australia. Happy Australia day. We are going on a dinner cruise on Lake Taupo.
Everyone is dressed up. We are going to have dinner and celebrate everything Australian.
Hello Ladies. What are you dressed up as?
Cowboys.....those are awesome costumes.
What are you dressed as? Man:Steve \irwin. I am going to catch a crocodile.
Good job Steve Irwin.

What are you guys dressed up as? Man: Surfer. Girk: As 
 an tribute to Australian flag. It was challanging to find.

It is actiually very challanging to find Australian flags in New Zealand. 
 Girl: We hit all the stores and we eventually found it.
